column4: I deleted my /etc/samba directory... how can I get the default config files back?
/usr/sbin/dpkg-reconfigure: samba is broken or not fully installed.
did you build it from source?
I tried reinstalling it to get the conf files back but it failed at the configure stage of spkg
did you use the package manager or apt-get ? or did you download and build the source?
try to "sudo apt-get remove --purge samba" first .... but you will get rid of all samba configuration/etc... files.
the config files still aren't there
ok... the obvious... /etc/samba/* belong to samba-common not samba
i have samba and it returns:
I fixed it... the config files belong to a different package...
